user_question: How does a solar eclipse affect solar energy production, and can you generate a code snippet to simulate this effect?
final_answer: A solar eclipse can temporarily reduce solar energy production by blocking sunlight. A code snippet to simulate this effect has been generated. Solar eclipses occur roughly every 18 months somewhere on Earth.
